channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine rollout to start in NI for 12 to 15 year olds
item.description: Children in Northern Ireland are to be offered a first dose of the Pfizer/BioNTech Covid-19 jab.

item.title: High Street vouchers to be issued in early October
item.description: The scheme aims to help businesses in retail and hospitality which have been hit by the pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: More than 10% of pupils not in school last week
item.description: Figures suggest about 10,000 pupils were at home due to self-isolation or social distancing.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records seven Covid-linked deaths, 1,590 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,468.

item.title: Royal Victoria Hospital: Mum's anger as baby's surgery cancelled
item.description: The one-year-old boy needs a cleft palate operation but it was cancelled at the last minute.

item.title: Northern Ireland nurses 'showing signs of inability to keep going'
item.description: The Royal College of Nursing calls for urgent action with hospitals under pressure.

item.title: Belfast missile-making firm Thales awarded MoD contracts
item.description: The contracts are awarded to Thales with the aim of producing "directed energy weapons".

item.title: Defamation: MLAs divided over Mike Nesbitt proposed law reform
item.description: Former UUP leader Mike Nesbitt is proposing local laws are brought into line with England and Wales.

item.title: Taylor Swift: Pop star poses for selfies in Belfast
item.description: Wildest Dreams came true when the American pop princess visited the city.

item.title: Brexit: Checks on goods imported from the EU delayed again
item.description: The government blames Covid and supply chain difficulties as it puts back changes.

item.title: Ulster University plans to help run new Coleraine secondary school
item.description: If approved, the integrated school would be located on Ulster University's Coleraine campus.

item.title: Covid-19: NI job market improves as furlough scheme nears end
item.description: Payroll data shows that there was an estimated 764,300 employees in August, up 0.5% on July.

item.title: John McDowell: Church of Ireland to enthrone new Armagh archbishop
item.description: Former Bishop of Clogher John McDowell will officially take up the position following a ceremony.

item.title: Covid: Booster jabs for over-50s expected to be announced
item.description: A single dose of Pfizer will be offered at least six months after a second dose, the BBC understands.

item.title: Covid: Children's education 'will benefit' from jab move
item.description: The UK's chief medical officers recommend all children aged 12 to 15 are offered one dose of a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Covid-19 vaccine clinics open on Northern Ireland campuses
item.description: Walk-in clinics will be available throughout September in a bid to get more more students vaccinated.

item.title: Covid-19: NI records eight Covid-linked deaths, 1,199 cases
item.description: The total number of deaths linked to coronavirus in NI since the start of the pandemic is 2,461.

item.title: Covid: More than 300,000 suspected of breaking quarantine rules
item.description: It comes as the prime minister prepares to announce his winter Covid plan, including for booster jabs.

item.title: Covid-19: Alliance MLA calls for greater clarity on schools' isolation policy
item.description: The chair of Stormont's health committee wants to see clearer messaging on stopping the spread of Covid.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: Covid-19: Schools safe for children and staff, says CMO
item.description: Sir Michael McBride says "certainty of long-term harm to many children" from not attending school.

item.title: Covid-19: Rules ease on dining, dancing and live shows in NI
item.description: The hospitality industry preparing for the removal of table service rules this evening.

item.title: Covid-19: Mallon announces plan to attract new taxi drivers
item.description: Some fees will be waived and a fare review will be launched says the Infrastructure minister.

item.title: Family of boy with disabilities 'drained' by lack of respite service
item.description: A health trust breached its legal duty to a severely disabled child amid the pandemic, says a judge.

item.title: NI 100: Parliament's temporary home in a Belfast college
item.description: It is 100 years since the Union Theological College was co-opted to be the centre of political power.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Northern Ireland landscape: Searching for the perfect picture
item.description: BBC News NI speaks to people spending their spare time looking for sunrises, storm clouds and stars.

item.title: All-Ireland SFC final: 'Tyrone's win built on a foundation devoid of ego'
item.description: Feargal Logan and Brian Dooher's lack of desire for the spotlight was the driving force behind Tyrone's ultimate team win.

item.title: NI Protocol: Five things we learned from Sefcovic visit
item.description: EU chief Maros Sefcovic spent two days in Northern Ireland - what did the visit reveal?

item.title: Lorry driver shortage: 'I'll never be stuck for work'
item.description: Amid a shortage of lorry drivers across the UK, people in Northern Ireland are training for the job.

item.title: High Street voucher: Start date for scheme due on Tuesday
item.description: A start date for Northern Ireland's £100 high street voucher scheme is to be announced on Tuesday.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccine clinics open across NI education campuses
item.description: Walk-in clinics have opened in universities and colleges in a bid to get more students vaccinated.

item.title: 'This is for them' - Hampsey hails Tyrone fans
item.description: Thousands of fans gather in Omagh's Healy Park for Tyrone's homecoming after their impressive All-Ireland Championship success.

item.title: Tyrone fans react to Sam coming home
item.description: Fans hail the new All-Ireland football champions, 13 years after the county last won the Sam Maguire cup.

item.title: Londonderry: Man dies in Clooney Terrace house fire
item.description: Police are conducting enquiries but say at this stage the death is not being treated as suspicious.

item.title: All-Ireland final: Tyrone players given heroes' welcome
item.description: Thousands of fans cheer on the All-Ireland champions at their home ground of Healy Park in Omagh.

item.title: Dungiven: Viable pipe bomb found during security alert
item.description: It was a "completely reckless" act to leave a device in a residential area, police say.

item.title: Driver killed in single-car crash in County Tyrone
item.description: Darren Canavan, 31, was pronounced dead at the scene on the Kilmascally Road in Ardboe.

item.title: Nancy Stewart: One of Ireland's oldest women dies aged 107
item.description: Nancy Stewart from Clonard in County Meath died on Friday morning at her family home.

item.title: Donegal mica: Crumbling house homeowners protest
item.description: Protesters want the Irish government to revamp a support scheme which they say is not fit for purpose.

item.title: Covid-19: 90% of adults in Republic of Ireland now fully vaccinated
item.description: The vaccine rollout is to continue across the country, with children 12 and over able to receive a jab.

item.title: County Kerry: Gardaí continues investigation into Ballyreahan deaths
item.description: The bodies of three members of the same family were found on Tuesday.

item.title: Leona Maguire: 'Incredible' homecoming for star Irish golfer
item.description: County Cavan turns out to welcome home Leona Maguire who helped Europe win the Solheim Cup.

item.title: County Kerry: Criminal investigation launched after three found dead
item.description: Gardaí (Irish police) say a firearm was discovered near to the body of one of the deceased.
